getDateFieldResolution

public int getDateFieldResolution(java.lang.Object propertyId)
Return DateField resolution for the Date filtering of the property ID. This will only be called for Date - typed properties. Filtering values output by the FilteringTable will also be truncated to this resolution. Parameters:

Specified by:
getDateFieldResolution in interface org.tepi.filtertable.FilterDecorator
Parameters:
propertyId - ID of the property the resolution will be applied to Returns: A resolution defined in DateField.

getDateFormat

public java.text.DateFormat getDateFormat(java.lang.Object propertyId)
Returns the DateFormat object to be used for formatting the date/time values shown in the filtering field of the given property ID. Note that this is completely independent from the resolution set for the property, and is used for display purposes only. Parameters:

Specified by:
getDateFormat in interface org.tepi.filtertable.FilterDecorator
Parameters:
propertyId - ID of the property the format will be applied to Returns: A DateFormat or null to use the default formatting.

getAllItemsVisibleString

public java.lang.String getAllItemsVisibleString()
Return the string that should be used as an "input prompt" when no filtering is made on a filter component. Returns: String to show for no filter defined.

Specified by:
getAllItemsVisibleString in interface org.tepi.filtertable.FilterDecorator

usePopupForNumericProperty

public boolean usePopupForNumericProperty(java.lang.Object propertyId)
Defines whether a popup-style numeric filter should be used for the property with the given ID. The types Integer, Long, Float and Double are considered to be 'numeric' within this context. Specified by: usePopupForNumericProperty(...) in FilterDecorator. Parameters:

Specified by:
usePopupForNumericProperty in interface org.tepi.filtertable.FilterDecorator
Returns:
true to use popup-style, false to use a TextField.
